alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 13 at 1:41PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst continues. * WHERE...Kenai River near Below Skilak Lake, Including Kenai Keys. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 130 PM AKDT, The Kenai River has crested at the outlet of Skilak Lake and at Kenai Keys. The crest at the outlet of Skilak Lake was around 15.2 feet early Wednesday morning. River levels will slowly recede and take until Sunday to drop below flood levels. - At 10.7 feet: In October of 2020, water was in the lowest lying garages of the Kenai Keys subdivision. At 12.0 feet: Water starts to flow over some of the roads in the Kenai Keys subdivision. At 13.2 feet: In 2012, water was 2 feet deep over Kenai Keys Road, near the entrance to the subdivison. At 13.5 feet: Water starts to flow into garages and cabins in the Kenai Keys subdivision; and likely flooding downstream. For Kenai River below Skilak Lake: At 12:30pm the stage was 14.99 feet. Flood Stage is 13.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 14.9 feet is expected around 4:00pm Wednesday. Impacts: At 15.0 feet: Water inundates the Kenai Keys neighborhood. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
